text:
and a follow-up question: is it bad for type inference if I have
```check_something() || throw(ArgumentError("my error"))```
in my function?

Even with Cthulhu I am having trouble finding where my type instability occurs

elements.text: and a follow-up question: is it bad for type inference if I have

in my function?

Even with Cthulhu I am having trouble finding where my type instability occurs

text: Type inference was turned off for exception-throwing blocks in 1.6. Most times it won't matter, but sometimes if you're using something in the error string, it can add an allocation or two and you might need to refactor to avoid it, if your code is performance critical.

elements.text: Type inference was turned off for exception-throwing blocks in 1.6. Most times it won't matter, but sometimes if you're using something in the error string, it can add an allocation or two and you might need to refactor to avoid it, if your code is performance critical.

text: it is... i am essentially trying to figure out why a portion of my code is type-unstable

elements.text: it is... i am essentially trying to figure out why a portion of my code is type-unstable

text: It shouldn't affect the return type inference, though. But might be worth removing them temporarily just to be sure.

elements.text: It shouldn't affect the return type inference, though. But might be worth removing them temporarily just to be sure.
